claim: Search and explore all the public tenders from the Centrale Unica di Commitenza through this portal
Ricerca ed esplora tutti gli appalti pubblici della centrale unica di committenza attraverso questo portale open
explore: Or browse through all the data
Or browse through all the data

title: Open Contracting. Open Government
Contractto aperto. Governo aperto
content:
OpenDataBasento offers open access to public procurement of the Comunità montana Alto Basento, in the region of Basilicate. All the data in the website is available to the general public without the need to register. OpenDataBasento aim is to promotore in a transparent and efficient way the spending of public funds, embracing the open competition among stackedholders that want to become suppliers for the Comunità.

Disclosing contracting information leads to improvements in competition and ensure a fair playing field for future government contractors.

title: Linked Open Data 5-star through semantic web
Il web semantico....
content:
The commitment to release data in an open access to be used by stackedholders and citizenships leads to adopt best practises for such openness and interoperability. Therefore, Linked Open Data provides the best practices to share data in an structured, interoperable way.

To do so, the procurement data of the Comunità montana Alto Basento is available through the eProcurement ontology, an information model standard developed by the Europen Comission which can be queried through our SPARQL endpoint on this website.

title: The data API
I dati API
content:
All the public procurement data is also structured in line with the Open Contracting Data Standard, an initiative that enables disclosure of data by defining a common data model. It was created to support organizations to increase contracting transparency.

Based on this standard, we offer an API to provide third parties to reuse the data or build other application based on this service.

overview1: The OpenDataBasento API is an application interface that allows any external developer or third-party software component to access OpenDataBasnto data on tenders and companies involved in the public procurement activity of the Centrale Unica Di Committenza. Data are published under CC BY-SA 3.0 license.
overview2: The API is read-only, freely accessible to all through HTTP requests at http://openbasento.unics.cloud/api. For further details, in the API section of this page are listed all the public available API resources in order to fetch the data.
overview3: The data avilable from the API is available in JSON format, following the schema of the Open Contracting Data Standard (OCDS), which enables disclosure of data and documents at all stages of the contracting process by defining a common data model. It was created to support organizations to increase contracting transparency, and allow deeper analysis of contracting data by a wide range of users.
overview4: The SPARQL endpoint of OpenDataBasento, available in the SPARQL section of this page, is a web service to query data integrated into the platform using the SPARQL language. The SPARQL endpoint also provides a set of tools that allows an immediate visual processing of the data obtained through the queries (among these, in particular, the 'Pivot Table' and 'Google Chart' tools).

Lo SPARQL endpoint dell'OpenDataBasento è un web service per interrogare i dati usando il linguaggio SPARQL. Lo SPARQL endpoint si compone altresì di un insieme basilare di strumenti che permettono l'elaborazione visuale immediata dei dati ottenuti tramite l'esecuzione delle query (fra questi, in particolare, gli strumenti 'Pivot Table' e 'Google Chart').

title: Overview
[italian version]
content: The API for Alto Basento is a publicly available interface to allow developers accessing the dataset containing all the registered tenders of the Centrale Unica di Committenza. The API is designed for developers, engineers, or anyone else who’s comfortable creating custom-coded solutions or integrating with RESTful APIs.

title: HTTP Methods
[italian version]
content: The API is read-only, so only the GET HTTP method is supported in order to retrieve data. GET requests will never cause an update or change to the data.

title: Open Contracting Data Standard
[italian version]
content: The response of the API follows the Open Contracting Data Standard (OCDS), which enables disclosure of data and documents at all stages of the contracting process by defining a common data model. It was created to support organizations to increase contracting transparency, and allow deeper analysis of contracting data by a wide range of users.

title: Available Resources for Alto Basento API
[italian version]

tender: The unique id of the tender
company: The unique id of the company

all: Returns all the available tenders. The response is a JSON array, containing a collection of tenders instances. The data structure of a Tender instance follows the definition of the tender section's JSON schema.
tender: Get information about a specific tender. The response is a JSON array, containing a tender instance. The data structure of a Tender instance follows the definition of the tender section's JSON schema.
company: Get information about a specific company. The response is a JSON array, containing a Company instance. The data structure of a Company instance follows the definition of the tender section's JSON schema.

intro:
The OpenDataBasento data also can be accessed by the machine readable SPARQL endpoint. SPARQL is a RDF query language, a semantic query language for databases. SPARQL endpoint is a conformant SPARQL protocol service. SPARQL endpoint enables users (human or other) to query a knowledge base via the SPARQL language. Results are typically returned in one or more machine-processable formats.

The models used to describe the public procurement data of Alto Basento relies mostly on the eProcurement Ontology, an standard specification developed by the European Comission
